Welcome to Kun Wang's homepage!

Talk is cheap, show me the code.

Highlight: TMS, a Turing machine simulator based on Introduction to the Models of Computation.

I am now a Ph.D. candidate of Computer Science in Nanjing University, China. I received my bachelor degree in computer science from Nanjing University in 2013 and was admitted to study for Ph.D. degree in the same year.

My research interests include Quantum Computing, Quantum Information, and Quantum Programming. Currently I am working on both theoretical analysis and experimental implementation of Quantum Walks.

In my free time, or whenever I feel blue, I dive into DotA, reading books, fitting and running. Also, I dedicated lots of my spare time into history of the world. Each programming language has its own privilege, I am coding often with Java, but my favorite one now is C.

Interested? Here's my resume, and please feel free to contact me.
